0.Pros: i got a lot of hours and they were all nice

1.Pros: salary, meet new people, and the discounts.

2.Pros: Entry-level, basic work for anybody looking for their first job. Nice people
2.Cons: Can be fast paced and stressful. Customers can be very unreasonable

3.Pros: discount on food, helped you with school and a good job for your first job
3.Cons: Manager didn't keep restaurant clean and yelled at her employees

4.Pros: Flexible, great high school job to have and work after school or on weekends.
4.Cons: Terrible benefits and little pay. Also, work meals should be 100% paid for after a shift.

5.Pros: Flexible schedules, easy work, nice coworkers; worked in high school and had another job, and the management was mostly accepting of my hectic schedule. Work was often pretty laid back, mostly worked the closing shifts with a lot of other young people. It was a really good learning experience, I worked there long enough that I got to train new employees and really got the hang of everything.
5.Cons: Management was a hit or miss, some managers were really nice, others not so much. Some coworkers were nice, some were high a lot of the time. Customers can be mean sometimes too. Manager would call me into a shift at the last minute "Hey can you work in 15 minutes?" a lot of the time we were understaffed

6.Cons: the reason why i left was because the last Gm dave was a little to touchy

7.Pros: Stable employment (if you're willing to stay), interesting people
7.Cons: mediocre pay , horrible under-staffing, and dealing with terrible human beings on a regular basis

8.Pros: Good first job experience, trains you how to deal with people on a professional level. Usually fun people to work with.
8.Cons: Very fast paced, stressful, always smell like french fries.

9.Summary: "Group interview . Store manager and assistant store manager were doing the interview."
9.Pros: you get free lunch during break.you get employee discount.
9.Cons: they don't pay you enough for the hours you worked
